content.title: Carotid Artery Dissection
content.description: Tear in the carotid artery wall causing intramural hematoma, luminal narrowing, and risk of stroke from thromboembolism or hemodynamic compromise.
content.definition: Carotid artery dissection is a tear in the intima or media of the internal or common carotid artery, allowing blood to enter the vessel wall and form an intramural hematoma. This can cause luminal stenosis or occlusion and serves as a nidus for thrombus formation and distal embolization. Important cause of stroke in young adults.

management: No clear evidence favoring anticoagulation over antiplatelet
Endovascular stenting for recurrent symptoms despite medical therapy

clinical_pearls: Carotid dissection is leading cause of stroke in young adults
Horner syndrome + ipsilateral headache = think dissection
Spontaneous dissection may indicate underlying FMD or CTD
Most heal with medical therapy - surgery/stenting reserved for failures
Screen for connective tissue disorders if spontaneous
